page.title: 11Fraserburgh Beach
page.content: On 27.5.85 we were down at the beach.We got some information. There was a whole lot of old tyres, nets and fish boxes.On the prom there are a lot of seats and litter bins.There was a lot of weathering on the rocks and on the steps.The beach is about 4km long.At 2.20 pm a boat was coming in. It was a fishing boat. The width from the seats to the sea is about 8m.The dry sand is like a yellow colour.The wet sand is like a dark gold.There is a mini railway line and you get on for 15p.There is a great big hill called Tiger Hill.It is about 100 feet steep.It got its name because a tiger was killed on it. There is a cement house that the soldiers used during the war.There are five rectangular windows.Last summer there was a door but it got filled up with cement.
